question: Can F-1 students work more than 20 hours on-campus while classes are in session?
answer: No—limit is 20 hrs/wk while school is in session.
law_ref: 8 CFR 214.2(f)(9)(i); USCIS PM Vol.2 Part F Ch.6

question: What counts as a full course of study for F-1 undergrads?
answer: Typically 12 credit hours per term unless authorized RCL.
law_ref: 8 CFR 214.2(f); USCIS PM Vol.2 Part F Ch.3

question: When is CPT allowed for F-1?
answer: After one academic year if eligible; DSO authorization; integral to curriculum.
law_ref: 8 CFR 214.2(f)(10)(i); USCIS PM Vol.2 Part F Ch.5

question: When is OPT allowed and what are limits?
answer: Pre/post-completion; must relate to major; STEM adds rules.
law_ref: 8 CFR 214.2(f)(10)(ii); USCIS PM Vol.2 Part F Ch.5

question: STEM OPT basics (I-983, E-Verify, reporting)?
answer: Training plan, E-Verify employer, periodic reporting.
law_ref: 8 CFR 214.2(f); USCIS PM Vol.2 Part F Ch.5

question: What is the F-1 60-day grace period?
answer: Up to 60 days after program or OPT completion for departure/transfer/COS.
law_ref: 8 CFR 214.1(l)(2); USCIS PM (Grace periods)

question: Can F-1 work off-campus without prior authorization?
answer: No, authorization required except limited on-campus.
law_ref: 8 CFR 214.2(f); USCIS PM Vol.2 Part F Ch.6

question: Can F-2 spouses study full-time in a degree program?
answer: Generally no; limited study permitted.
law_ref: USCIS PM Vol.2 Part F Ch.9

question: Can F-2 spouses work in the U.S.?
answer: No employment authorization for F-2.
law_ref: USCIS PM Vol.2 Part F Ch.9

question: Can a J-2 spouse work? What’s needed?
answer: Yes, with USCIS EAD after filing based on J-2.
law_ref: 22 CFR 62.12; USCIS I-765; USCIS PM Vol.2 Part D

question: Does the J-1 two-year home residency rule (212(e)) apply to me?
answer: Depends on funding/skills/country; see 212(e).
law_ref: INA 212(e); 22 CFR Part 62; USCIS PM Vol.2 Part D

question: Can a J-1 student work on-campus and what limits?
answer: Limited on-campus employment per sponsor rules.
law_ref: 22 CFR 62.23; BridgeUSA guidance

question: What happens to J-2 EAD if J-1 status ends?
answer: J-2 work authorization ends when J-1 status ends.
law_ref: 22 CFR 62.12; USCIS PM Vol.2 Part D

question: When can an H-1B start at a new employer (portability)?
answer: Often on USCIS receipt of nonfrivolous petition.
law_ref: 8 CFR 214.2(h)(2)(i)(H); USCIS PM Vol.2 Part H

question: What evidence is needed for H-1B portability start?
answer: USCIS receipt, maintenance of status, nonfrivolous filing.
law_ref: 8 CFR 214.2(h); USCIS PM Vol.2 Part H

question: Are H-4 spouses eligible for work authorization?
answer: Some under (c)(26) when H-1B spouse reaches stages.
law_ref: 8 CFR 274a.12(c)(26); USCIS PM Vol.10 Part B Ch.2

question: Can H-4 children work?
answer: No, H-4 children are not employment authorized.
law_ref: 8 CFR 274a.12; USCIS PM Vol.10

question: Travel + H-1B change of employer pending: can I return and start?
answer: Fact-specific; portability may allow start, travel complicates.
law_ref: 8 CFR 214.2(h); USCIS PM Vol.2 Part H

question: How long is H-1B grace period after layoff?
answer: Up to 60 days in specific circumstances.
law_ref: 8 CFR 214.1(l)(2); USCIS policy

question: Is unpaid volunteering allowed for roles normally paid?
answer: Generally no for roles normally filled by paid workers.
law_ref: USCIS PM employment guidance; 8 CFR 214.2
